text: At that time King Merodach-baladan son of Baladan of Babylon sent envoys with letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he heard that he had been sick and had recovered.

Hezekiah welcomed them; he showed them his treasure house, the silver, the gold, the spices, the precious oil, his whole armory, all that was found in his storehouses. There was nothing in his house or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.

Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and said to him, &#34What did these men say? From where did they come to you?&#34 Hezekiah answered, &#34They have come to me from a far country, from Babylon.&#34
He said, &#34What have they seen in your house?&#34 Hezekiah answered, &#34They have seen all that is in my house; there is nothing in my storehouses that I did not show them.&#34
Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, &#34Hear the word of the LORD of hosts:
Days are coming when all that is in your house, and that which your ancestors have stored up until this day, shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left, says the LORD.
Some of your own sons who are born to you shall be taken away; they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.&#34
Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, &#34The word of the LORD that you have spoken is good.&#34 For he thought, &#34There will be peace and security in my days.&#34
